lead_paragraph: Baltimore Orioles closer Danys Báez has a partial tear in his right elbow and will probably miss the rest of the season. Manager Dave Trembley said yesterday that Baez, 30, would seek a second opinion after a magnetic resonance imaging exam Friday revealed the tear. Trembley said Báez would decide on surgery or rehabilitating the injury. Báez, a right-hander, is 0-6 with three saves and a 6.44 earned run average in 53 games.
